alert.note: Alert for Brown (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 06 at 10:20PM CDT until May 06 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHERN BROWN COUNTY... At 1018 PM CDT, Rainfall within the warned area has ended. A secondary road was reported impassible near Brookesmith at l009 PM CDT. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is likely continuing. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Camp Bowie, Brookesmith, Winchell, Zephyr and Indian Creek. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... CR 201 crossing Clear Creek, County Road 201 crossing Clear Creek and crossings along County Road 228. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
